title: Life Was Built Around Snow. What Happens When It Vanishes?
description: The melting of the snowpack in the high Cascades has long been a predictable source of sustenance in the Pacific Northwest. But the old patterns are changing.
dc:creator: Ruth Fremson and Kirk Johnson
media:description: The borderlands at their feet, straddling Oregon and Washington, nurture farms and ranches, fruit-growing and fishing. The powerful winds that blow up the Columbia River attract windsurfers from around the world.
